thread.title: Police identifies 19-year-old following Christmas Eve shooting
thread.title_full: Police identifies 19-year-old following Christmas Eve shooting

author: Jenni Williams
title: Police identifies 19-year-old following Christmas Eve shooting
text: Asheville PD identifies 19-year-old following Christmas Eve shooting Officers found 16 shell casings nearby Asheville PD identifies 19-year-old following Christmas Eve shooting Officers found 16 shell casings nearby SNOW COMING OUR WAY. CHRIS. THANK YOU. AND NOW TO WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA, WHERE ASHEVILLE POLICE ARE INVESTIGATING A SHOOTING THAT HAPPENED ON CHRISTMAS EVE. OFFICERS SAY IT HAPPENED JUST BEFORE 9:30 P.M. NEAR DEPOT STREET WHEN THEY ARRIVED, THEY SAY THEY FOUND A 19 YEAR OLD MAN AT A GAS PUMP WITH MULTIPLE GUNSHOT WOUNDS TO THE UPPER BACK. THE VICTIM WAS TRANSPORTED TO MISSION HOSPITAL AND IS IN CRITICAL CONDITION. IF YOU H Advertisement Asheville PD identifies 19-year-old following Christmas Eve shooting Officers found 16 shell casings nearby The Asheville Police Department is investigating a shooting that left a man in critical condition on Christmas Eve.Officers said that they responded to a business near the 400 block of Depot Street around 9:20 p.m. on Sunday and found a 19-year-old man at a gas pump with multiple gunshot wounds to his back.Officers said that they found 16 shell casings in the area.If you have any information about this shooting, you are asked to contact the Asheville Police Department at 828-252-1110, or you can send an anonymous tip using the TIP2APD smartphone app or by texting TIP2APD to 847411. ASHEVILLE, N.C. â€” The Asheville Police Department is investigating a shooting that left a man in critical condition on Christmas Eve. Officers said that they responded to a business near the 400 block of Depot Street around 9:20 p.m. on Sunday and found a 19-year-old man at a gas pump with multiple gunshot wounds to his back. Advertisement Officers said that they found 16 shell casings in the area. If you have any information about this shooting, you are asked to contact the Asheville Police Department at 828-252-1110, or you can send an anonymous tip using the TIP2APD smartphone app or by texting TIP2APD to 847411.
